office: The Office of Congressman Jim Baird (IN-04)
key_responsibilities: to answer the telephones
to greet visitors to the office
to answer constituent requests for general information, tours, and other inquiries
to monitor delivery and pickup of materials
to maintain front office
to assist with various administrative and legislative duties
requirements: professional telephone manner
proficiency in word processing
ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others

key_responsibilities: oversee all operations of the district offices, including the development and implementation of policy objectives, strategies and operating plans
direct all activities and staff of the district offices
recruiting, hiring, training, and managing district staff
ensure that district staff complies with office policies, practices, and procedures
represent the Member and/or assigns appropriate staff to do so at events or functions through the district as needed
strategizing, developing, and implementing district communications and outreach plan for constituents, including casework management
serve as the primary liaison between the Congresswoman and constituents and special interest groups in the district
act as an advisor for the Congresswoman on local concerns, district issues and politics, and other developments throughout the region
requirements: minimum of 3-5 years of management experience
strong ability to provide necessary organization, leadership and motivation to manage a Congressional office
excellent oral and written communication skills
thorough knowledge of the legislative process

key_responsibilities: developing and planning legislative initiatives
monitoring legislative developments in-portfolio within committees and on the House floor
writing floor speeches for the Member
drafting constituent correspondence
meeting with constituents and advocacy groups on behalf of the Member
other assigned tasks
requirements: at least two years of substantive legislative, policy, or related experience
ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with occasional non-traditional work hours
familiarity with the scope and duties of the House legislative process
strong writing, interpersonal, self-motivation, and organizational skills

office: Progressive Member of House Democratic Leadership and the Appropriations Committee
key_responsibilities: manages and mentors the legislative team to advance the Member’s broad legislative agenda, including significant work in the areas of foreign policy and national security, global health, poverty, and reproductive rights and justice
works closely with the Chief of Staff, Communications team, and District Director to ensure the legislative strategy is reflected in all aspects of the overall office operations
requirements: outstanding communications skills
ability to work in a dynamic team environment
knowledge of House operations and procedures
an understanding of the budget and appropriations process
foreign policy and national security policy experience
at least five years of legislative experience, including management experience

office: The Energy & Commerce Committee, Democratic Staff
key_responsibilities: handling of substantive legislative and administrative tasks, including staffing hearings and markups, conducting oversight, and drafting legislation
requirements: strong writing, analytical, legislative, and organizational skills
proven ability to perform under pressure while juggling multiple tasks with competing priorities
willingness to work long hours and weekends
sound political judgment
experience working with relevant public interest groups, relevant agencies, Congress, and industry

key_responsibilities: handle all communications strategy and media operations for an unusually busy office

oversee all day-to-day press operations including writing press releases, managing the social media portfolio, pitching stories, responding to reporters’ inquiries, producing newsletters, overseeing website content, developing, building relationships with local and national media and organizing press conferences and media events
develop and implement a strategic communications plan
requirements: excellent research, writing and social media skills
ability to handle multiple tasks and issues effectively while meeting deadlines
political savvy needed to anticipate big news stories and to proactively promote the Member’s message
at least three years of prior media and/or Hill experience and demonstrated experience with both mainstream and new media outlets
salary: based on skill and experience level

key_responsibilities: oversee all operations of the district offices, including the development and implementation of policy objectives, strategies and operating plans
direct all activities and staff of the district offices
recruiting, hiring, training, and managing district staff
ensure that district staff complies with office policies, practices, and procedures
represent the Member and/or assigns appropriate staff to do so at events or functions through the district as needed
strategizing, developing, and implementing district communications and outreach plan for constituents, including casework management
serve as the primary liaison between the Congresswoman and constituents and special interest groups in the district
act as an advisor for the Congresswoman on local concerns, district issues and politics, and other developments throughout the region
requirements: minimum of 3-5 years of management experience
strong ability to provide necessary organization, leadership and motivation to manage a Congressional office
excellent oral and written communication skills
thorough knowledge of the legislative process

key_responsibilities: Establishing and maintaining relationships with Connecticut, national, and D.C.-based media
Coordinating all media efforts and communication-related events
Drafting and distributing press releases and media advisories
Creating, editing, and placing op-eds
Developing, editing, and posting content across all social media platforms
Pitching stories to reporters and producers, including national and Connecticut media, responding to press inquiries, and serving as the point-of-contact for media
Monitoring media narratives and identifying opportunities to promote the Congresswoman
Overseeing Franked communications strategy
Updating the Congresswoman’s website and ensuring that it features timely content
Coordinating and staffing the Congresswoman for interviews and events
Managing a small team of press assistants
requirements: proactive concerning press engagement
superior written and oral communication skills
prior political, legislative, and communications experience

office: The House Democratic Policy and Communications Committee (DPCC)
key_responsibilities: design and execute a proactive digital messaging strategy for the DPCC and assist with the digital reach of House Democratic offices
creating graphics and custom videos
managing relationships with digital media outlets and identifying new audiences for House Democrats to reach online
managing all digital platforms of the DPCC
drafting sample digital content to be used by other Democratic offices
maintaining and updating websites
tracking analytics
offering new, proactive ideas for growing the DPCC’s digital presence and supporting House Democrats
requirements: creative, proactive, team players, who are able to successfully manage multiple tasks at once
previous experience and passion for creating video and graphic content and familiarity with Adobe Creative Suite
strong understanding of the digital media landscape and the latest digital trends and the ability to identify opportunities to reach new audiences online

office: The Office of Congresswoman Abby Finkenauer (IA-01)
key_responsibilities: Creating and managing the Congresswoman’s schedule in Washington, DC and in Iowa
Building a long term scheduling plan in conjunction with other staff and the Congresswoman
Responding to invitations for meetings and events in a timely manner
Managing the Congresswoman’s travel, and logistics in DC and Iowa
Managing the Congresswoman’s time throughout the day in DC
Preparing memos and briefings for all meetings and events in coordination with event participants and the appropriate staff members
Keeping staff members and the Congresswoman updated in real time about schedule changes
Maintaining files of invitations that have been declined, accepted, or that are tentative/pending
Processing travel and expense receipts for the Member
Additional duties related to operation of the DC and District offices
requirements: scheduling experience, ideally with a Congressional office, a political campaign, or a similarly fast-paced organization
attentive to detail, organized, and proactive

office: Congressman John P. Sarbanes, a senior member of the Health Subcommittee on the House Energy & Commerce Committee
key_responsibilities: advising the Member on all matters in the issue portfolio
developing and advancing policy proposals
drafting vote recommendations and talking points for related floor and committee proceedings
staffing the Member in relevant meetings
representing the Member before constituents and stakeholders
requirements: previous work expertise on health policy
prior legislative experience advising a Member of Congress and advancing policy proposals
excellent written and verbal communication skills
eagerness to work in a fast-paced, collaborative office

key_responsibilities: drafting constituent letters
sorting and batching mail
assisting the legislative staff with various projects
requirements: strong conservative credentials
effective writing and research skills
attention to detail
ability to manage multiple tasks at once

key_responsibilities: Drafting short- and long-term DC and district calendars
Working with internal and external stakeholders to maximize time efficiency
Coordinating all travel, including extensive international committee-based trips
Driving the Member in DC
Assisting with Member’s personal correspondence
Anticipate and proactively provide solutions to expected issues with schedule
requirements: previous Hill or other scheduling and/or fast-paced operations role experience

key_responsibilities: assisting the Communications Director with day-to-day operations
creating daily social media and video content
tracking press clips and traffic on social media
drafting press releases, op-eds, newsletters, and video scripts
requirements: self-starter who works well under pressure
capacity to problem solve
excellent written and verbal communications skills
close attention to detail
Degree in political science, communications, or relevant field
1-2 years of professional experience in communications, relevant internships accepted
Outstanding writing and communication skills
Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment and meet deadlines

key_responsibilities: providing a high volume of ethics advice, education, and training to Members of Congress and their staff through frequent telephone calls, in-person meetings, and written work product
requirements: outstanding analytical and written and oral communication skills
sound judgment necessary to evaluate the sensitive matters that arise before the Committee

Experience in one or more of the following areas is desirable: government ethics; ethics counseling and training; employment law, including the laws governing sexual harassment in the workplace; and criminal law

key_responsibilities: Creating and updating the Member's schedule in DC
Responding to invitations for DC meetings and events
Communicating with the District team about invitations for District events
Managing the travel plans and logistics
Preparing meeting briefs and binders for all meetings and events in DC
Maintain a weekly schedule that balances the Member's official and unofficial time in DC
Working with the Chief of Staff to review schedule requests
Processing vouchers for travel and expense reimbursement for the Member and staff
Oversee and assisting the Staff Assistant as needed with answering the phone, greeting visitors, and managing the intern program
Additional duties related to managing the overall operation of the DC office
requirements: scheduling experience, ideally with a Congressional office, a political campaign, or a similarly fast-paced organization
extremely attentive to detail, organized, and proactive

key_responsibilities: support the legislative team as needed
requirements: effective writer and researcher
good communication skills
experience with managing constituent mail systems
perform well in a fast pace work environment

key_responsibilities: drafting legislation
writing hearing statements and legislative memos
preparing briefing materials
requirements: 3-5 years of experience, ideally 2-3 on the Hill
solid grasp of House procedures and a deep understanding of relevant policy
Excellent writing, verbal and organizational skills
ability to be a self-starter while working in a fast-paced environment

key_responsibilities: None
requirements: minimum of 2 years’ experience managing a team
excellent oral and written communications skills
highly organized
meet deadlines
manage multiple projects
flexible schedule and ability to travel throughout the district
